title: Bug 18028: Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
description: When attempting to rename a package, the system doesn't check if all resources are writeable, leading to unexpected exceptions.
OB: When attempting to rename a package with a read-only file inside it, the system allows the renaming process but results in an unexpected exception dialog.
EB: The system should perform a precondition check to ensure that all resources within the package are writeable before allowing the package to be renamed. If any resources are read-only, it should prevent the renaming process and provide an error message to the user.
SR:
1. Open the application (F1+).
2. Create a package with a Compilation Unit (CU) inside it.
3. Make the Compilation Unit read-only (set it to read-only mode).
4. Attempt to rename the package containing the read-only CU.
5. Observe that after finishing the renaming process, you get an unexpected exception dialog.
